channel.description: Recent content in Posts on lhrb

item.title: Duality between data and code
item.description: The first sentence on the Wikipedia page about “Code as data”: In computer science, the expressions code as data and data as code refer to the duality between code and data, that allows computers to treat instructions in a programming language as data handled by a running program. [0] I strongly associate the phrase “data as code” with LISP and I absolutely do love to speak about LISP but this time I will try to explore the other way around: “code as data”.

item.title: Continuous Delivery for personal projects
item.description: If you are like me, you build side projects from time to time. Some of them are application running on a server. This led me to the question what is a lightweight and simple way to deploy those application. Do I need to setup a full CI/CD pipeline? These are often heavy tools to run production grade software. Maybe a simple script is good enough for my use-case? After all, I’m most likely to abandon this project after a while.
